crnrstn_element.crnrstn_description:
Within the CRNRSTN Suite ::, the functionality associated with session management is an integral component. Although the successful configuration of CRNRSTN may not be dependent upon the PHP SESSION, in order to gain efficiencies in runtime operation, the obvious benefit of PHP SESSION state management is fully capitalized upon in order to persist information that CRNRSTN would otherwise need to continuously re-evaluate and bringing with this unnecessary repetition the added side-effect...understandably...of degrading the applications' performance.
Once an environmental configuration within CRNRSTN has been selected, the "#winning" profile is immediately associated with the running PHP SESSION, and all other potential environmental profiles are discarded. On subsequent requests, the PHP SESSION is checked for consistency of integrity to ensure that the state of connectivity has not changed (e.g. transition from VPN to public network), and if all is well, the request will be handled accordingly.
When initSessionEncryption() has been invoked within the configuration file to configure CRNRSTN for encryption, this encryption layer (which CRNRSTN leverages for the management of its own internal affairs) will also be exposed to the application developer through...primarily...two (2) methods of the session_manager :: class object. Therefore, throughout the application...the invocation of both setSessionParam() and getSessionParam() will push and pull data through the encrypt/decrypt layer which will have been configured within the CRNRSTN Suite::.
